required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound for Measurement of Muscle Perfusion
clinical_study.official_title: Measurement of Peripheral Muscle Microperfusion and Macroperfusion in an Animal Peripheral Artery Disease Model Using Contrast-enhanced Ultrasound and Doppler Flow Measurement

oversight_info.authority: Germany: Ministry of Work, Health and Social Affairs in North Rhine-Westph

brief_summary.textblock: Non-invasive measurement of peripheral muscle microperfusion (PMP) using contrast-enhanced ultrasound (CEUS) could improve management of peripheral artery disease (PAD) patients and allow for evaluation of new therapies.

detailed_description.textblock: In a porcine animal model, perihperal muscle perfusion will be quantified using CEUS replenishment kinetics the thigh musculature during i.v. steady-state infusion of an ultrasound contrast agent. Macroperfusion was quantified at the common femoral artery using a Doppler flow probe. Microperfusion and Doppler flow measurements will performed bilaterally at rest and under adenosine stress after unilateral creation of a moderate distal external iliac artery stenosis.

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic

secondary_outcome.description: Doppler flow measurement of arterial inflow

clinical_study.condition: Porcine Peripheral Artery Disease Animal Modell.

arm_group.description: Adenosin stress is performed, and CEUS is performed during at both rest and stress.

intervention.description: CEUS is performed at adenosine stress in addition to baseline measurements at rest.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy pig (domestic)
- 30-40 kg body weight
Exclusion Criteria:
- na

responsible_party.investigator_title: Attending at the Department of Radiology
